executive_summary: Blind and shade manufacturers have faced significant volatility in recent years, mainly driven by the fluctuating health of the construction sector. The 2020 pandemic initially resulted in substantial losses in the nonresidential real estate markets, which can be attributed to stay-at-home orders and work-from-home capabilities, while the residential market boomed amid low interest rates and growing disposable income. However, increasing inflationary pressure and interest rate hikes led to growing economic uncertainty, harming demand from the residential sector as many existing homeowners postponed or canceled the upgrade of blinds and shades. Although the nonresidential industry has begun to grow, these gains have been unable to mitigate the losses from the residential sector. These trends caused revenue to fall at an estimated CAGR of 1.8% to $2.4 billion through 2024, including a 1.5% jump during that year alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Industry Has Been Volatile and Has Mostly Declined Overall
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: - Uncertain economic conditions in recent years have encouraged consumers to conserve money and postpone replacing their blinds and shades. - Favorable economic conditions during the early stages of the pandemic enabled demand for blinds and shades to rise as consumers took on more home improvement projects and purchased more homes. - Elevated inflation and growing economic uncertainty led to rapid declines in the residential sector, which resulted in sharp revenue losses when combined with a weak nonresidential market. - Interest rates went from nearly zero percent to more than 5.0% as the Federal Reserve navigated the pandemic and the consequent spike in inflation. These changes have directly impacted the construction sector, resulting in significant revenue volatility.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Operators Have Still Contended With Several Long-Term Threats
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Foreign producers are increasingly threatening domestic manufacturers. Imported blinds and shades account for close to 45.0% of domestic demand, causing the domestic market to shrink and harming US producers. Lower operating costs overseas, including lower wage requirements and environmental regulations, enable foreign producers to offer lower prices. As a result, sales in the business have been somewhat hampered by overseas competition. The recent appreciation of the dollar has enabled international producers to appeal to an increasingly price-conscious market. A strong US dollar makes imported products comparatively more affordable than domestically produced ones, harming sales. Another problem for domestic manufacturers is the fluctuating cost of raw materials. Plastic, wood and aluminum prices for window and blind input materials have grown drastically in recent years.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Businesses Are Looking Toward Cutting Costs
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Manufacturers have been forced to implement a number of cost-cutting strategies to address the challenges posed by import competition and fluctuating input costs. Many companies have tried to cut operational costs by merging businesses and eliminating locations that were not profitable or failing to compete with low-priced imports. To become more competitive, manufacturers have also opted for mergers and acquisitions. Many large producers have bought smaller brands to take advantage of economies of scale, which allows them to lower their cost of production per unit and increase profits while raising wages. Many manufacturers have also opted to move operations overseas to countries with lower operating costs to become more profitable. This trend has caused the industry to shrink.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: There Will Likely Be a Shift in Construction Markets
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The ongoing economic recovery is likely to benefit blind and shade manufacturers. Weakening inflation and the possibility of interest rate declines create opportunities for the construction sector to recover by increasing consumers' financial capabilities. Residential construction recovery is forecast to drive blind and shade sales. Since many residential construction projects take longer to complete and window coverings are bought after residences are finished, revenue gains will likely occur over the coming years. The lengthy lead times involved with commercial structures cause these projects to frequently lag behind residential construction by one to two years. As a result, current gains from the nonresidential sector will reflect over the coming years, enabling revenue to grow faster.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: There Will Likely Be a Strong Increase in Globalization Within the Industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry is expected to keep going global. It is anticipated that imports will continue to account for a sizable portion of domestic demand, restraining industry expansion. The expected depreciation of the US dollar over the coming years is forecast to boost demand for domestically produced blinds and shades, as a weaker dollar makes them comparatively more affordable than imported products. Although the dollar's depreciation is likely to weaken the share of domestic demand satisfied by imports, it will not have a significant impact, mainly because of the drastically lower operating costs foreign manufacturers benefit from.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Changing Regulations Are Affecting Operators' Decisions
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: According to the Window Cover Covering Manufacturers Association, the American National Standards Institute (ANSI) approved a new window-covering safety standard in January 2018. This standard mandates that most window covering products sold in the US be cordless or have difficult-to-reach or short cords. New product development and ensuring compliance with new requirements will likely disrupt operations, driving operating costs higher as they adjust their manufacturing methods and preventing profit from growing significantly. Similarly, continuous volatility in the price of inputs, such as synthetic fiber and plastic materials, will make it challenging for manufacturers to control operating expenses, take advantage of their purchasing power and safeguard their profit.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry manufacture window coverings, including Venetian and other window blinds, shades, curtain and drapery rods and poles and other related fixtures. After production, window furnishings are distributed to wholesalers, retailers and contract outfitters. From there, they are sold to residential, commercial and institutional markets. Curtains and draperies are excluded from this industry.
key_trends: Blind and shade manufacturing revenue has fluctuated significantly.
Unfavorable economic conditions, including weaker disposable income and higher interest rates, have encouraged homeowners to delay the purchase of new blinds and shades to save money.
Consumers have remained financially cautious and cost-conscious.
Although the residential sector has expanded significantly since the last recession, unfavorable economic conditions have slowed growth trends.
A minimal but rising level of regulation applies to the Blind and Shade Manufacturing industry.
US manufacturers offer a broad selection of blinds that may be tailored to fit particular shapes and sizes.
Manufacturers of blinds and shades cater to both the home and commercial markets.
The geographic distribution of manufacturers generally mirrors the population distribution.
Manufacturers in this industry differentiate themselves from their internal rivals.
Manufacturers of blinds and shades also face competition from draperies and curtains. Since blind and shade manufacturers don't produce these, they act as substitutes.

Although there are some large manufacturers, the industry is fragmented. Smaller businesses may find it more challenging to enter the market and successfully compete as a result of this concentration.
Smaller, specialist players have the opportunity to stand out through product innovation, personalization and distinctive value propositions due to the industry's structure of enterprises.
Profitability varies based on multiple factors. These include size, supply chain connections, distribution capabilities, geographical location and breadth of their product and service offerings.

The adoption of automated tools has enabled wage costs to weaken. Continuous technological developments will likely make manufacturing processes more efficient, allowing the wages to continue falling as a revenue share.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Manufacturers serve retailers indirectly through wholesalers, mainly because small retailers often fail to meet manufacturers' order minimums. Some manufacturers, however, have started to bypass the intermediaries and sell straight to clients to boost profit. Smaller furnishing and specialty stores will continue to rely on wholesalers to acquire blinds and shades. Large, nonresidential construction projects are also more likely to purchase blinds and shades from wholesalers, as purchasing large quantities from retailers can result in significantly higher costs for a given project.

Customers buy blinds and shades from home improvement businesses when they want to renovate their homes, similar to what they do with furniture stores. More consumers have sought home improvement retailers to buy energy-efficient blinds and shades as they have grown more conscious of the value of window coverings for light management. Home improvement stores benefited from a jump in demand during the early stages of the pandemic. The healthy residential market and increased free time for many homeowners boosted demand for home improvement projects.

Other retailers include department stores, warehouse clubs and supercenters, general merchandise stores and specialty blind and shade retailers. Large manufacturers are increasingly becoming vertically integrated to bypass third-party companies and sell directly to buyers, mainly through an e-commerce platform. Demand for other retailers is anticipated to have weakened as bricks-and-mortar general merchandise stores have struggled to keep pace with different retail segments amid weaker economic conditions and declining revenue.

When consumers buy a new house or upgrade their current property, they become more likely to purchase new window coverings. Consumers between the ages of 35 and 64 are more likely to buy homes and remodel them, making them account for a significant market share. On the other hand, due to their relative lack of cash, younger generations are less inclined to buy blinds. Changes in disposable income and consumer confidence impact demand for home furnishing shops. Consumers are more inclined to visit these stores when economic conditions are favorable and they have the resources to spend on discretionary goods.

products_and_services.product_description: Window shades include window coverings made from various materials, such as plastic, canvas, wood and metal, along with any necessary rollers and accessories.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Other Blinds and Shades, Including Fixtures and Accessories
products_and_services.product_description: Other window covering products include curtain and drapery rods, poles, rollers and plastic metal clasps, which make up the majority of revenue. This segment also includes other blinds composed of a variety of materials. Fixtures and accessories are used in all window coverings, including those not included in this industry, creating demand for blind and shade manufacturers from other markets.

This segment includes related parts and Venetian blinds made from a range of materials, such as bamboo, canvas, chip, metal, plastic, rattan, aluminum and wood. Blinds often have slats that can be turned back and forth to manage light and privacy. A blind can be entirely lowered and still let light through, unlike a shade. Blinds are widely used in commercial buildings and are supplied in large quantities due to agreements with contractors, designers and architects.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand for window furnishings increases as more homes, condominiums and apartments are built. Since the residential construction sector generates significant demand for blinds and shades, a decline in the value of residential construction poses a potential threat to the industry.

Consumers are less likely to purchase nonessential home furnishings such as blinds and shades when consumer confidence falls. Conversely, an increase in consumer confidence signals consumers have more discretionary income to spend on industry purchases, representing a potential opportunity.

An affordable way of changing a home is by including new features that adapt to consumers' preferences and lifestyles, such as blinds and shades that block light appropriately. As a result, consumers investing in their homes through home improvements boost demand for new window furnishings and fixtures.

international_trade_points.trade_title: US Consumers Turn to Foreign Window Coverings
international_trade_points.trade_description: Foreign manufacturers can offer lower prices due to less restrictive labor rules, resulting in less expensive products. The rising value of the US dollar has made imports more affordable, increasing their attractiveness to domestic buyers.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Mexico and China Dominate the Import Market
international_trade_points.trade_description: The majority of window blinds and shades imported into the US originate from Mexico and China. These countries have less stringent labor laws that keep operating expenses low, allowing for competitive pricing.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Exports Suffer Under COVID-19 Lockdowns and a Strong US Dollar
international_trade_points.trade_description: Exports have suffered over the past several years due to a strengthening US dollar, which makes US goods less affordable for foreign buyers. Exports have also suffered due to tariffs and global supply chain constraints owed to COVID-19 lockdowns.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Canada and Mexico Are the Top Destinations for US Window Coverings
international_trade_points.trade_description: The majority of window coverings manufactured in the United States are destined for Canada and Mexico. Macroeconomic factors may support the sale of blinds and shades to these neighboring countries, preventing further declines in exports despite external challenges.

business_locations.location_description: Florida's high local demand probably causes this concentration. The state's bright, sunny climate makes blinds and shades more beneficial for both homes and businesses to control light and temperature. To be close to sources of demand, operators have constructed a sizable number of production facilities here. Florida is also a notably business-friendly state.

Due to the abundance of urban areas and the concentration of wealth in the region, the Mid-Atlantic has a significant concentration of industrial establishments. Additionally, the area creates a sizable amount of economic activity, which suggests a sizable demand for business blinds and shades in the area. Additionally, the area serves as a transportation hub, allowing business owners to export their goods internationally.

With 12.1% of the US population, California is the most populated state in the union. It also has the most industrial establishments. This is primarily a result of the region's ordinarily sunny weather, which increases demand for blinds and shades to protect homes and businesses from excessive sunshine. The vast population of the Western region also contributes to the need for industrial goods.

regulations_points.regulation_description: To ensure worker safety, blind manufacturers must adhere to Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) guidelines.
To provide child-safe window covering cables, the US Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC) collaborated with manufacturers of blinds and shades.

In 2020, new and expanded health and safety regulations were implemented due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Such recommendations encouraged continued sanitary measures inside facilities and brief social isolation.

barriers_points.barrier_description: No specific factors for increased or decreased barriers to entry are mentioned in the given text.

basis_points.basis_description: Manufacturers differentiate themselves through quality, design, variety, pricing and services of their offerings.
Manufacturers face competition from draperies and curtains which act as substitutes.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The industry is highly fragmented with no major company holding a large portion of the market.
Mergers and acquisitions are common among manufacturers to remain competitive and improve efficiencies.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: THE NEED FOR SKILLED WORKERS LEAD TO HIGH LABOR COSTS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Manufacturers traditionally rely heavily on workers to design products, operate machinery and run daily operations, all of which often require skilled workers. Significant import penetration has forced many manufacturers out of the industry and other businesses to reduce their workforces to reduce costs and retain profitability. Manufacturers have increasingly adopted automated technologies to increase efficiency and lower operating costs. These technologies weaken demand for human labor, pushing wages down.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: SIGNIFICANT INPUT PRICE FLUCTUATIONS IMPACT PURCHASE COSTS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wood, plastic and aluminum are the three primary basic materials used to make industrial products. However, manufacturers use multiple materials during production, including finished metal products, shade cloths and fabrics with plastic coatings, paperboard containers and corrugated paperboard. Changes in demand and supply chain disruptions in recent years have led to significant input price volatility. As consumption bounced back in 2021, the price of many popular inputs, such as plastic and steel, jumped, harming manufacturers. The significant price competition within the industry prevents manufacturers from passing cost increases to customers, making producers susceptible to input price volatility and causing purchasing costs to swell.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Manufacturers rely heavily on workers to operate machinery, design new products and run operations.
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Manufacturers rely heavily on workers to operate machinery, design new products and run operations.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Low levels of innovation limit the threat to incumbent operators from new technologies disrupting their operations.
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Low levels of innovation limit the threat to incumbent operators from new technologies disrupting their operations. However, a low rate of growth in technology can also create exposure for incumbents as the trajectory of innovation in other markets could lead to unforeseen competitive disadvantages.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified.
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified. The spread of market segments suggests that there are limited entry points other than those already served by incumbent operators.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Performance Fluctuates in Response to Economic Changes
volatility_points.volatility_description: Given that window coverings are frequently regarded as luxuries, any change in consumers' discretionary budget or alterations in their confidence level may deter or encourage the purchase of window coverings. Favorable consumer-related economic conditions, such as declining unemployment and rising per capita disposable income, have consistently boosted sales in recent years. Higher inflation and growing economic uncertainty have recently discouraged downstream buyers from unnecessarily replacing products like blinds and shades.

Prices also affect industry revenue. As blind and shade prices rise, buyers frequently seek more alternatives, including curtains and drapes, which are not a part of this business. Price volatility results from rising transportation costs and fluctuating costs for the raw materials required. The current period has seen significant price swings in resin and plastic materials, which has caused income in the industry to change.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Revenue for the Industry Varies as a Result of the US Housing Market
volatility_points.volatility_description: Since window coverings are a household commodity, their demand decreases when neither new homes are built nor sold. During the early stages of the pandemic, the residential sector benefited from rising disposable income and near-zero interest rates. As more consumers moved and took on home improvement projects, blind and shade sales grew. Significant interest rate hikes during the economic recovery and rising inflation disrupted the growth of the residential construction sector. This, alongside an already struggling nonresidential construction sector, resulted in revenue plummeting.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: WINDOW SHADES ARE THE MOST POPULAR PRODUCT
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Window shades include window coverings made from various materials, such as plastic, canvas, wood and metal, along with any necessary rollers and accessories. Plastic window blinds significantly contribute to revenue. Despite being a sizable portion of the overall market, shades made of materials other than plastic only account for a small portion of sales. Shades are more efficient as insulators than slatted blinds, making them an attractive option for consumers looking to reduce their utility bills. As energy prices have increased, more consumers have demanded insulating window coverings in recent years.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: With the Industry Comes a Variety of Shades and Blinds
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Other window covering products include curtain and drapery rods, poles, rollers and plastic metal clasps, which make up the majority of revenue. This segment also includes other blinds composed of a variety of materials. Fixtures and accessories are used in all window coverings, including those not included in this industry, creating demand for blind and shade manufacturers from other markets. As consumers continue to buy curtains, shades and blinds, they will need related hardware. Demand for other products will be directly impacted by new construction projects and spending on home improvements. Therefore, demand for other shades and blinds has recently faced significant fluctuations.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Venetian Blinds are Becoming More Popular
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: This segment includes related parts and Venetian blinds made from a range of materials, such as bamboo, canvas, chip, metal, plastic, rattan, aluminum and wood. Blinds often have slats that can be turned back and forth to manage light and privacy. A blind can be entirely lowered and still let light through, unlike a shade. Blinds are widely used in commercial buildings and are supplied in large quantities due to agreements with contractors, designers and architects. As a result, one of the biggest consumers of Venetian blinds is the commercial construction sector. Blinds are also standard for residential rental units, as they are often made of plastic and can be a more affordable alternative for landlords to replace in between renters.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or provide a broad range of products?
FAQs.answer: Blind and shade manufacturers offer a range of products, including window blinds, shades and other fixtures made from a diverse selection of materials. Offering a range of products enables brand loyalty as homes and businesses seek to obtain all of their window coverings from one company. Operators that manufacture a variety of product types tend to be better insulated from economic downturns.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: The health of the US economy is important for this industry, which relies on high levels of consumer spending and construction activity. Economic growth drives demand for blinds and shades because as homes are newly built or remodeled, they will require new window coverings. In 2020, industry operators were negatively affected due to lower construction activity amid the coronavirus pandemic, particularly within the private non-residential sector.

FAQs.question: Is your company investing heavily in R&D to meet changing consumer preferences?
FAQs.answer: R&D investment has been crucial for blind and shade manufacturers to stay on top of changing trends in new products and efficiency improvements. Modern window coverings with value-added features are more expensive to produce, increasing the amount manufacturers must outlay on R&D. Manufacturers also invest heavily on R&D relating to the production process, as production efficiencies give operators room to lower prices.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the years?
FAQs.answer: The prices of both sawmill lumber and plastic materials and resins have been volatile over the past five years. Amid the coronavirus pandemic, supply chain volatility has increased for industry operators. Volatile input prices can threaten profitability if manufacturers are unable to negotiate steady contracts with suppliers.

FAQs.question: How does your company invest in technology, such as solar shades, to establish a competitive edge over your competitors?
FAQs.answer: Some companies have introduced solar shades, which allow shades to trap air and insulate rooms from heat and cold. Some solar shades (such as Hunter Douglas' Honeycomb collection) are eligible for a federal tax credit due to their energy saving qualities, increasing their appeal to consumers.

FAQs.question: How is your company leveraging new technology, such as online order and tracking tools, in its operations?
FAQs.answer: Putting tools on company websites permits clients to track the status of orders themselves, reducing customer service costs for manufacturers. Online ordering also makes it easier for downstream markets, such as wholesalers, to make purchases. With the COVID-19 pandemic creating volatility throughout global supply chains that disrupted standard operations, the use of technology can help streamline operations in terms of efficiency and limit the impact of supply chain disruptions.

FAQs.question: Do you work with trade associations or other interest groups to advance your company's interests?
FAQs.answer: Manufacturers receive assistance through associations such as the Window Coverings Association of America and the Window Coverings Manufacturers Association. These associations conduct industry trade shows, list current industry trends, and provide a network to exchange information and ideas.

FAQs.question: Is your company adequately prepared to adjust to changing regulations in blind and shade cords?
FAQs.answer: The US Consumer Product Safety Commission has worked with blind and shade manufacturers to make child-safe window coverings cords. As a result of growing lobbying efforts from parents concerned with window cord safety, new regulations for window covering cords were implemented in 2018. Generally, however, the industry is not highly regulated.

FAQs.question: What is your company doing to improve profit margins?
FAQs.answer: Many large industry manufacturers, such as Springs Window Fashions, have started outsourcing their window coverings manufacturing to China and Mexico. Additionally, operating costs can be reduced by closing unprofitable facilities that are unable to compete with low-priced imports. Industry operators have struggled to maintain their profitability in the face of increasingly stiff import competition from foreign producers. Moreover, in 2020, industry profit took a hit due to lower downstream demand amid the COVID-19 pandemic, with the outlook for industry profit looking stagnant as a result of this demand effect.

FAQs.question: What has been the typical industry profit margin in recent years?
FAQs.answer: Industry profit, measured as earnings before interest and taxes, accounted for 4.2% of revenue in 2022. Moving forward, the industry's profitability is expected to stagnate amid uncertain macroeconomic conditions, even as the economy recovers following the COVID-19 pandemic. Many large companies have acquired smaller brands to leverage economies of scale, achieving lower per-unit production costs and boosting profit margins.
